WorkItem.Description:
Chirpy does't work with VS 2010 SP1 on ASP.NET 4 but works fine with VS 2010 SP1 on ASP.NET 3.5 or earlier!!!
Some confusing...
Thanks

Comments.Message:
More detail.
File type js, css...
File minifer mode (yui,google...)

I just installed Chirpy for the first time directly through the VS addins menu in VS2010.  I have a .NET 4 website that I am trying Chirpy on.  

I've tried creating a test.yui.js and a test.chirpy.js file and neither one of them did anything.  No min files were created and no codebehind shows up.  All of our code is in TFS if that helps.

Update: I looked into this even more.  It appears that the version that appears in the VS2010 Extention Manager is not the latest version of Chirpy.  I downloaded v2 from the front page of Codeplex and installed it.  Chirpy appears to be working just fine on my .NET 4 website.  It does add the .min files and they appear as "code-behind" files in the UI.  Thanks!

Details:
 - VS 2010 (with no SP or with SP1), ASP.NET 4 (not ASP.NET 3.5)
 - File types: js, css, less and any other
 - File minifer mode: ms, google, yui and any other!!!

* Some times files are minifed, but isn't included in project
* When you want save a js (or any other) without minifer, got an error
